raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Lactones.", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "Hydroxy acids contain both a hydroxyl (-OH) group and a carboxylic acid (-COOH) group. When these undergo intramolecular esterification, the hydroxyl group of one part of the molecule reacts with the carboxylic acid group of the same molecule, forming a cyclic ester called a lactone. Ethers would require two hydroxyl groups, nitriles contain C≡N groups, and amides would require an amine group. The student incorrectly chose amides, but the correct answer is lactones."}
